programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top Ten Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker

programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: Exposed

programme.title: Murder Gardens 2
programme.desc: After serving ten years in prison, Chase returns to Miami Gardens with a goal of reclaiming his life. But the criminal empire that he was once part of has changed and his older brother Rell is now one of the heads. He recruits Chase for one last job.

programme.title: Dr. Ira Reid: Haverford College's Unsung Scholar Activist
programme.desc: Dr. Ira De Augustine Reid, was a prominent sociologist and proficient writer who wrote on the lives of black immigrants and communities throughout the United States. Follow along his story of perseverance and relentless pursuit and how he became the first tenured African-American Faculty member of Haverford College and left a historical impact on the world of academia.

programme.title: Single Black Female
programme.desc: College freshman Rose quickly forms a bond with her new roommate, Max. But Max's intense loyalty soon takes a dangerous turn.

programme.title: Single, Saved and Searching

programme.title: Too Little Too Late
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse when a philandering man with blood on his hands discovers his fiancée is pregnant.

programme.title: The Christmas Spirit
programme.desc: This Christmas, Faith is forced to choose between taking over her recently deceased father's church or handing it over to a new minister.

programme.title: Giving Thanks

programme.title: Thick Trip
programme.desc: Four close-knit friends, all single and yearning for a change, embark on a summer-long 'Queen's Trip' to South Padre, Houston, and the untouched wilderness. As they travel and experience the vibrant cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they confront their fears, rediscover their passions, and explore their own wild sides.

programme.title: Hoodie Girls Gang
programme.desc: Kayla's boyfriend Jamal is jailed and needs $10,000 bail. Desperate, Kayla and her friends plan an armed robbery. However, the heist goes wrong, and the police are on their trail. To make matters worse, Jamal's boss, Sean, demands payment for the drugs Jamal was transporting. Kayla must now free Jamal and escape town before both the police and Sean catch up to her.

programme.title: The Comeback
programme.desc: A couple moves with their daughter back to Atlanta, their hometown. They remember exactly why they left when an old flame and family issues resurface.

programme.title: Love and Leftovers
programme.desc: Jacob is a successful chef with big dreams of opening his own restaurant, but struggles in his personal life due to his demanding girlfriend, Drina. When Lisa, a strong-willed and grounded woman comes along and sees his potential, Jacob finds himself torn between something familiar, or something new.

programme.desc: A renowned gunslinger with a storied past, Tom Horn (Steve McQueen) opts for a reclusive life until he starts working for rancher John Coble (Richard Farnsworth). Though Horn begins seeing pretty local teacher Glendolene Kimmel (Linda Evans), he remains restless. First they bust a convicted man out of jail, and then they force him to commit a string of robberies to increase the price on his head. Finally, they murder him and collect the bounty. Lawman Bob Gifford (Audie Murphy) is onto their vicious plan, and he goes undercover as a prisoner to lure in these savage villains. But he struggles to stay focused after crossing paths with a sweet saloon owner (Colleen Miller).

programme.title: Canyon River

programme.title: The Moonlighter
programme.desc: Wes Anderson (Fred MacMurray) is caught cattle rustling and promptly jailed. The public is outraged, but, since Wes always worked at night, they don't know what he looks like. Still, they break into the prison and lynch a hobo they think is Wes, while the actual culprit sneaks off to see his old flame, Rela (Barbara Stanwyck), who has recently taken up with his straitlaced brother, Tom (William Ching). But Tom is envious of his outlaw brother, and he decides to join Wes in a life of crime.

programme.title: 3 Godfathers
programme.desc: Thieves and rustlers Robert Hightower (John Wayne), Pete Fuerte (Pedro Armendáriz) and the Abilene Kid (Harry Carey Jr.) rob a bank in a small Arizona town. Pursued across the desert by the indefatigable Sheriff Buck Sweet (Ward Bond), the trio lose their horses, suffer injuries, and come across a stranded woman (Mildred Natwick) who is dying while giving birth. Promising to carry the woman's newborn to safety, the repentant criminals struggle to reach the village of New Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Shootist
programme.desc: A dying gunfighter, J.B. Brooks, spends his last days looking for a way to die with a minimum amount of pain and a maximum amount of dignity.

programme.title: Firecreek
programme.desc: Johnny Cobb (James Stewart) is the part-time sheriff in a small, rundown town, trying to stretch his meager salary to provide for his growing family. Poor Cobb isn't much of a gunman, and he isn't particularly suited for fighting, but he's the man in charge when a gang of bandits led by Bob Larkin (Henry Fonda) rides into town. The tension rises as the bandits make themselves at home in Cobb's town, but when a gunfight breaks out, Cobb finds himself pushed to the limit.

Now Yancy must find a way to ease the last vestiges of the Civil War before someone dies!

programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A cabdriver develops chest pains and seizures; a hotel manager is found dead on the steps of his apartment.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A man is found dead in a motel room due to multiple shotgun wounds. Dr. G proves the scene isn't what it seems.

programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with summer maintenance in his wildlife garden and recommends plants for deep, dry shade under trees, as well as giving advice on what to plant now for late summer harvests.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants bulbs in pots, including hyacinths and daffodils. He shares tips and advice on what to do when apples and pears have been affected by diseases such as canker and brown rot. Plus, he gives a timely guide on how to collect and save seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Presenting from York Gate in Leeds, Adam Frost, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill celebrate a garden for all seasons and tackle a bunch of seasonal jobs for September.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings throughout the seasons. Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey in Cambridgeshire, a garden designed to look its best in winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: We are taking a look inside the life of a pro hockey player and avid fisherman - Zack Hayes, aka @HAYZOUTDOORS!Introducing, Zack Hayes, a true big-time hunter, fisherman, and hockey player. programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills “Stomper,Jr.” and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Fort Ti
programme.desc: Capt. Horn (George Montgomery) and Rogers' Rangers raid Fort Ticonderoga during the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Black Noon
programme.desc: In the Old West, a young, traveling minister and his wife get caught up in a web of witchcraft involving a mute beauty and a satanic gunfighter.

programme.title: Shut My Big Mouth
programme.desc: An Eastern milquetoast (Joe E. Brown) takes on outlaws in the Wild West.

programme.title: Indian Uprising
programme.desc: Gold thieves and the government rile Geronimo, despite a cavalry captain's (George Montgomery) efforts at peace.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Robin Hood
programme.desc: In this swashbuckling classic, the legendary hero fights to rid England of the tyranny of Prince John and win the love of the beautiful Maid Marian.

programme.title: The Americanization of Emily
programme.desc: A black comedy about honor, cowardice and unexpected heroism.

programme.title: City for Conquest
programme.desc: A driver risks his sight when he boxes to pay for his brother's education.

programme.title: A Guy Named Joe
programme.desc: A bomber pilot goes to heaven and becomes guardian angel to another pilot.

programme.title: The In-Laws (1979)
programme.desc: The father of the groom drags the bride's father into madcap adventures.

programme.title: Logan's Run
programme.desc: In a dystopian world where people face mandatory death at the age of 30, an elite police officer is tasked with hunting down those who try to escape.

programme.title: Time After Time
programme.desc: When Jack the Ripper steals his time machine, H.G. Wells tracks him down.

programme.title: The Lusty Men
programme.desc: A faded rodeo star mentors a younger rider but falls for his wife.

programme.title: Tom Horn
programme.desc: Steve McQueen stars as a legendary American as untamed as the Old West.

programme.title: Lone Star
programme.desc: A frontiersman helps out with Texas's fight for independence from Mexico.

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: A nun cannot maintain her vow of peace when Nazis murder her father.

programme.title: The Office Wife
programme.desc: A gold-digging secretary sets out to lure her boss from his straying wife.

programme.title: The Rise and Fall of Legs Diamond
programme.desc: In Prohibition-era New York, ferocious mobster Jack "Legs" Diamond rises through the underworld ranks, but learns he's no match for a deceitful woman.

programme.title: They Won't Believe Me
programme.desc: A faithless husband is charged with a murder he didn't commit.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Chin Ho shares news about Joe White that rocks McGarrett to his core; Danny is forced to play midwife when his ex goes into early labor.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Danno and his family are targeted by a vengeful dirty cop from Danno's past, the team steps in to help.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the team almost causes an international incident, Lt. Gov. Denning decides that one of them should be fired; Chin Ho faces the harrowing task of choosing a Valentine's Day gift for Malia.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates when a man dressed as a Hawaiian NaKoa warrior is found dead near the site of a war re-enactment.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team crosses paths with a retired NYPD bomb expert while investigating the death of a famous talk-radio host.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When McGarrett's sister is arrested for smuggling diamonds, he enlists the help of an ex-con to set up a sting.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Max reveals shocking information about his childhood to help the team track a serial killer who may have ties to Max's past.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a suspect threatens to release a deadly virus, the Five-0 teams up with Special Agents G. Callen (Chris O'Donnell) and Sam Hanna (LL Cool J).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When McGarrett finally gets to Wo Fat, he is stunned to learn that the Japanese Yakuza wants them both dead.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team goes on a manhunt when one of its own is killed; a team member must choose which one of their kidnapped loved ones will survive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Following the murder of an important family member, the team searches for Delano and Wo Fat.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett asks Catherine to help find his mother; the teams seek assistance from August March (Edward Asner) with a deadly art heist.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett's day at sea takes a deadly turn when their boat is hijacked.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett's mom pays him an unexpected visit while the team investigates a polo player's death.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: As the team investigates a grisly murder, evidence suggests the killer is about to strike again.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A bizarre case involving a man who was chopped in half baffles the CSIs; Natalia's injury puts her and Ryan in jeopardy.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs have 24 hours to determine if a man on death row is really guilty; Eric Delko returns to work on the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates a case of a man who was murdered in outer space.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Eric go to Los Angeles to clear Jesse's name after accusations of evidence tampering arise; Horatio faces a dangerous element within the LAPD.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle hopes to avenge his brother's murder by tracking a drug ring in Alabama he believes is responsible; when Pride assists with the case, he crosses paths with Eddie Barrett, an elusive individual who knows more than he is sharing.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Following a natural gas explosion at a movie theater, the team discovers the gas company has been hacked and more explosions could be triggered.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Sebastian calls the team to assist with a possible kidnapping case when a dignitary's son he was assigned to protect disappears from a local concert venue.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Eddie Barrett provides an alibi witness, Pride and the team are more determined than ever to find a break in the case and avenge Lasalle's murder.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride is cut off from the team and backed into a corner after the investigation into Eddie Barrett uncovers a malicious plot.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team is concerned when Sebastian becomes unreachable while under cover as a new recruit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team must track down a mysterious female assassin responsible for murders in Athens, Rome and London; Wade's son begs her to allow him to go on a police ride-along for an article he's writing on a youth outreach program.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a JAG captain who was discovered at home by his daughter, the only heir to his large estate; Sebastian is intimidated when he is put in charge of a team on his first day of training.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is unable to sleep due to continuing nightmares about the mysterious man in the red suit, he undergoes a specialized treatment to help him figure out the man's identity; an arrogant new officer joins the team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy must protect a teenage girl after her father is shot in their home; the rest of the team searches for a motive.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a man impersonating Lasalle attempts to free a young woman from jail, the team investigates both the impostor and the prisoner; Pride's daughter pays him a surprise visit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in New Orleans when a white officer shoots a black Navy officer he believed was armed in the middle of a busy street party.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy sailor is found dead, the team tracks the suspicious movements of people in his life prior to his death; Hannah comes to terms with her daughter's relationship with her ex's new girlfriend.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Deaths follow the discovery of a valuable musical manuscript sold cheaply at an auction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From classic 60's muscle cars to modern day Corvettes, from a brand 'new' '90 Toyota Supra with only 191 miles on the clock to '58 Impala convertible and a 2012 McClaren, Las Vegas offers something for every bidder.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: One-of-a-kind American cars have made their way to Houston with cars like the 1968 Chevrolet Corvette Copo and the 1959 Chevrolet 100 hitting the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions offers something for everyone, from Mustangs to Camaros, Bentleys to Maseratis, beasts like the Hummer H1 and off-roaders like the Land Cruiser.

programme.desc: The best of the best are coming across the auction block as Barrett-Jackson celebrates 50 years in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man attempts a daring rescue of his aging relatives from the rising storm waters; the Woodchucks don't make their deadline and their company hangs in the balance; S&S finally hits a honey hole with the help of Swilley's brother.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man targets a money log in dangerous territory; DJ gets put on notice; Brad and Swilley struggle to keep S&S from running off the rails.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe faces a crew mutiny; the guys at Lemare put their chaser to the test; Shelby and Belinda take to the open road to bring home a money log; James Smith lashes out against his own crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby builds his new empire one big toy at a time; the men of S&S Aqua Logging deal with last week's fallout; DJ suffers an injury that could take him out of the season; a whole new kind of logging.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.desc: A seller hops in with a first edition of "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland"; a pair of Red October Nike Air Yeezy 2s kicks into the shop; a seller is looking at Corey when he brings in an autographed "Casablanca" movie poster.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The shop travels back in time when a map from the late 1800s comes in; Corey spots a killer Mustang for sale; Rick takes a ride to check out a collection of transistor radios; Chum and Rick get their hands on Magic: The Gathering prototype cards.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum sniffs out a 1920s Baccarat bottle of Ybry perfume; Rick takes a look at a sealed copy of the Spiderman and Venom: Maximum Carnage video game; Corey weighs the odds on a gambling kit from the 1800s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer soars into the shop with a rare H.G. Wells book, and an astronomical asking price, Corey shoot for the stars; there's no horsing around when a statue made of turquoise moseys on in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey dart out of the shop to check out a 1968 convertible; Chum wants a piece of an oreodont fossil; Rick has quite an experience when a seller sends in a Jimi Hendrix poster; a Harry and the Hendersons doll hits the counter.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller walks into the shop hoping to score with his Magic Johnson 50th birthday invitation; Chum takes a look at some joker playing cards used as props in "The Dark Knight"; Corey heads to the range to test out a Civil War-era derringer.

programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog goes after a fugitive named Tracy who lives in a homeless shelter, but the shelter's staff is uncooperative, and the two sides get into an angry confrontation that forces Dog to temporarily back off.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Upset because one his puppies may die and wanting to give the little guy a second chance in life, Dog decides to offer one of the fugitives a second chance, too.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: While hunting an elusive deep sea fisherman, Dog is also trying to plan a great Mother's Day for Beth, but he's having problems finding the special flowers Beth wants.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source - Bozo's father-in-law. When they find Bozo, he protests his wife-beating charge, saying he never hit her with his fist, only his open hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take on the heartbreaking case of Rachel. Rachel's mom bailed her out of jail on condition that she go to AA meetings and stick to a curfew.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Dog's birthday, and he plans to celebrate in the same way he has for the last twenty years. There's no taking the day off to indulge himself for this bounty hunter--he's tracking down a fugitive!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For a guy who started life as a free spirited outlaw-biker Dog has certainly turned into a family man. His children touch everything he does today, from searching for the perfect gift for his daughter Cecily's birthday to hunting a fugitive.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Join Dr. Rae and Peter as they explore American black bears. Dr. Rae visits New Hampshire for a vital den inspection with local wildlife experts, while Peter shadows a cub caretaker to see how abandoned cubs get a second chance.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Dr. Rae heads to Panama to explore the extraordinary, slow world of sloths. She tours a rescue and rehab center, meets the team saving these threatened animals, feeds orphaned babies, and helps rescue and release sloths back into the wild.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae visit the remote U.S.–Mexico border to uncover ocelots. With fewer than 200 left in South Texas, Dr. Rae joins ranch researchers and a renowned photographer, while Peter explores genetic efforts to grow the population.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae connect with harpy eagles, apex raptors of the Americas. Peter tours Florida raptor sanctuaries with conservationists; Dr. Rae visits Panama, where the harpy—national bird—holds deep cultural meaning.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae uncover Southeast reptiles in unlikely places: Dr. Rae aids an Atlanta sanctuary saving the Suwannee River alligator snapping turtle; Peter helps protect baby American crocodiles at a South Florida nuclear plant.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Dr. Rae and Peter spotlight coatis. Peter visits Brevard Zoo to see a breeding program boosting wild numbers. In Arizona’s Sonoran Desert, Dr. Rae uncovers Indigenous records of US coatis and tracks modern ones with scientists and photographers.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Manatees, the South's gentle giants, face climate change, habitat loss, and human threats. Peter visits the Columbus Zoo, where Stubby mothers orphan Squirrel. At Florida's Blue Spring, Dr. Rae helps release rehabilitated manatees back to the wild.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Dr. Rae and Peter meet North America’s cutest wild babies: they help rehab orphaned black bear cubs at New Hampshire’s Kilham Bear Center, track elusive baby ocelots in South Texas, and join conservationists rescuing baby sloths in Panama.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae explore the Great Lakes, holding 20% of Earth’s fresh water. Peter joins Michigan DNR to survey threatened sturgeon; Dr. Rae fights Illinois River invasives and tracks piping plovers’ migrations to show their impact on lake health.

programme.title: TV-G
programme.desc: Peter and Dr. Rae fight to save critically endangered sawfish off Cape Canaveral amid habitat loss, overfishing, and a mysterious infection. Peter tags wild fish; then they head to the Bahamas to study ecology and meet rare captive sawfish.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While conducting a drilling operation at the Triangle Area, the team not only detects dangerous energy spikes, but also discovers something that may have come from outer space.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team uses high-powered Tesla coils to shoot electricity into the oddly conductive soil of Skinwalker Ranch, it stimulates an otherworldly encounter.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
