programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. Their MO was familiar -- the gang used precise timing to steal millions in cash and burned their getaway cars to destroy evidence. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, Texas was terrorized by a brutal serial killer who traveled by train. The FBI assembled a task force to gather information about the dangerous drifter and create a profile that would help locate him. As they learned that the killer had traveled extensively through the United States and Mexico, the murders became more frequent, and authorities had to cast a dragnet over an entire continent in an effort to catch him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Washington D.C, a car bomb takes the life of a former ambassador and his secretary. The FBI is on the case and begins sifting through layers of a wide-ranging conspiracy. The scope of the investigation broadens when it becomes apparent that a foreign government, ruled by a ruthless dictator, ordered the attack. Agents and prosecutors must engage in a political tug-of-war to uncover the identities of the assassins.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Four inmates from a Delaware Correctional Center turn up missing in the middle of the night. A few hours later, a stolen vehicle is recovered; inside, one of the inmate's fingerprints is found, as well as the address book of one of the other fugitives. A multi-state manhunt ensues with the help of the FBI. A nearby robbery report is the agent's first tip, followed by a murder in the same neighborhood.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In New York, the FBI and local police join forces to battle the constant influx of Colombian cocaine into the city's ports. One detective goes undercover, posing as a Mafia wise-guy, and infiltrates a drug gang connected to Pablo Escobar's Medellin cartel. The detective must be bold, but cautious, taking on the role of a tough-guy, but always aware that if the gang suspects anything, they won't hesitate to kill him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Brian & Beverly Mauck were found dead in their Graham, Washington home. Using a bloody palm print and shoe prints at the scene, investigators focus their attention on Daniel Tavares, who had previously been inking a tattoo on Brian's back.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A World War II veteran was found dead in his home, and the investigation ground to a halt when the prime suspect had a solid alibi. But a lucky break led to a shady character who wore distinctive boots and had a sweet tooth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It's usually easy to determine how a criminal entered the crime scene. But in this case, it was far from clear. It looked like the killer vanished into thin air...and perhaps he had.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Digital enhancement of security camera video shows that what appears to be a casual encounter is actually a forced abduction, leading to murder. When investigators suspect the crimes are not random, they fear a serial killer may be on the loose.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Kathy Lorick was murdered on a Concord, California jogging trail in the middle of the day while talking to her husband on her mobile phone.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35, was convicted of killing David Nixon in April 2002 after he planned to end their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When¾two women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The killer probably hoped to cover his tracks by staging the crime scene. But investigators saw through the attempt almost immediately, and turned to forensic science to learn what really happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman attends evening church services... then disappears. When her abandoned car is found, the tank is empty and a gas can she kept in her trunk for emergencies is missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression apparently took her own life. But her sister told police that, a year before her death, she said if anything were to happen to her, there was a note in the china cabinet.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman could have lost control of her SUV on the icy road, and plunged down an embankment into a shallow creek. But there were footprints in the snow leading away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college student is reported missing, police believe their investigation will be like countless others. But when they discover blood spatter in her boyfriend's bedroom, they know this case is going to be different.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college co-ed vanished without a trace, her fellow students were concerned about her safety and their own.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 12, 1994, Crystal Perry was viciously murdered in her home in Bridgton, Maine. Michael Hutchinson, 32, was found guilty of murder in the 1994 slaying at Perry's home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Nevada politician Kathy Augustine died mysteriously during a hard-fought re-election campaign and the medical examiner could neither isolate the cause of death, nor explain the tiny puncture wounds discovered during the autopsy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, Illinois emergency response came upon a garage fire and a man was found crushed beneath a truck.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Tiffany Rowell and three of her friends were brutally murdered in their affluent Clear Lake, Texas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police get a clue about a couple who disappeared on Memorial Day weekend during an in-progress robbery. The evidence found solves a brutal crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was well liked and successful, which made the brutality of the crime even harder to understand.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Rebecca Barney and her soon-to-be ex-husband Fred were found shot to death in their Tulsa, Oklahoma, home, which had been set on fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, 19-year-old Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. For ten years, her disappearance remained a mystery, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin 'Butch' Hinton.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run boating accident caused the death of a popular young man, investigators faced the daunting task of searching for one boat among 1200 others.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police get a clue about a couple who disappeared on Memorial Day weekend during an in-progress robbery. The evidence found solves a brutal crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Avis Banks and her unborn child were brutally murdered. The body was discovered by her fianc_ Keyon Pittman. Police learn Pittman was having affairs with other women and he became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A family vacation turns into a nightmare when the wife is found face-down in the lake.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Nevada politician Kathy Augustine died mysteriously during a hard-fought re-election campaign and the medical examiner could neither isolate the cause of death, nor explain the tiny puncture wounds discovered during the autopsy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Michigan State University grad student disappeared and was presumed dead. With the help of a professor of geological sciences, police hoped to get the 'dirt' on her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a respected police officer was murdered in her own home. The crime went unsolved for more than a decade, and then a newly formed Cold Case Unit took a fresh look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, Colorado real estate developer Alan Helmick was found shot to death at home by his wife Miriam, who then became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young, attractive hairdresser was sexually assaulted and murdered in her own beauty salon. The evidence at the crime scene didn't match any of the suspects and, after the initial investigation, the case went cold for ten years.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Shamaia Smith disappeared from the strip club she worked at in East Hartford, CT. Police look at various customers of the strip club, but focus on local businessman Kenneth Otto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The prime suspect had a criminal record, and his driver's license was found at the scene of a brutal double-homicide.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial killer was on the loose and police had to find him before he struck again. Their most promising lead was an unusual one: a bloody fingerprint on the body of one of the victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, Kathy Lorick was murdered on a Concord, California jogging trail in the middle of the day while talking to her husband on her mobile phone.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman is found dead in her apartment. With little evidence at the scene, the case turns cold... until police discover a link between their prime suspect and an unsolved murder committed six years earlier in a different state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Palm Beach waitress Denise O'Neill is abducted and murdered. Her neighbor Luis Caballero arouses suspicions by his odd behavior toward TV crews covering the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A surgeon is stabbed to death, and the most likely suspect is seen in a restaurant at the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A twelve-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibers on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an off-duty policeman was shot dead, his fellow officers were determined to solve the crime. They needed clues to find the killer, and they discovered them in tiny fibers and an asthma inhaler.

programme.title: S13:E16 - Desenmascarado
programme.desc: Un violador en serie anda suelto en una ciudad de Texas. Nadie sabía dónde atacaría a continuación, pero la audacia de sus ataques y la escalada de violencia contra sus víctimas hicieron que encontrarlo fuera imperativo.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35, was convicted of killing David Nixon in April 2002 after he planned to end their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Files

He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.desc: A wedding forces Marti, Savannah and Dan to confront their true feelings. Vanessa and Derrick (D.B. WOODSIDE) face a tough decision. Alice visits Jake (RYAN KENNEDY) in jail.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah is blown away when Charlotte (EMMA LAHANA) reveals the identity of her baby's father. Plus, the Hellcats learn they and Memphis Christian have something in common.

programme.title: Power Players
programme.desc: Jason Kelly visits the UK's Motorsport Valley, where Williams Team Principal James Volwes and F1 Academy drivers' champion Abbi Pulling show how advanced simulation is shaping the future of Formula 1.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Bloomberg The Asia Trade - bringing global investors everything you need to know as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with high-profile guests in the heart of global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Tech

The program brings the audience interviews from the biggest names in the business, offering in-depth analysis and critical insights.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Weeks after a pregnant woman is shot and killed in Orlando, a shootout between her suspected killer and a police officer sparks a manhunt.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a book about choosing weird, a torch-wielding craftswoman, and a family bakery burning the midnight oil? The same place where alleyways have meaningful names and the American River changed the course of triathlons.

programme.title: KCRA Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCRA.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: More than money makes the crime world go round. You won’t believe the odd array of goods that have been stolen over the years -- and the motivations behind the thefts.

programme.title: Farm to Fork: Growing a Movement
programme.desc: How cities are harnessing the power of agriculture to make real differences in the health and happiness of community members.

programme.title: Breaking Bread
programme.desc: Dig into the famous farms behind Sacramento’s status as America’s farm-to-fork capital. We’ll travel from the kitchen to the land, exploring olive and walnut farms with the visionary chefs hand-sourcing ingredients for inspired dishes.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: California Politics 360
programme.desc: KCRA 3's Political Director Ashley Zavala speaks with Border Patrol Chief for the El Centro Sector Gregory Bovino in a one-on-one interview about recent immigration raids.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: In Kansas City, you can’t say tattoos without saying the name Wes Grimm. For three tattoo artists, he’s not just a name — he’s also a judge. Can these artists design a tattoo worthy of the name, and who will have just enough heart to win?

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A passionate beekeeper in Omaha, and a Pittsburgh based seasoned mosaic artist.

programme.title: KCRA 3's Explore Outdoors
programme.desc: Mike TeSelle spotlights beautiful and historic places across Northern California

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a skier who turned her tragedy into the state's biggest charity event, to a cyclist who energizes others with maple syrup, you can't take the "Vermont" out of Burlington athletes.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero is not at the zoo – but he does have some questions about wild animal stories to ask his Queen City contestants.

programme.title: The Freedom Center
programme.desc: Across centuries of struggle, freedom has carried many meanings, some painful, some powerful. This documentary pulls back the curtain on forgotten stories and surprising truths, leaving one question: what does freedom really look like today, and what might it become tomorrow?

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion aren’t slowing down; they’re rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: MMA champion Michelle Waterson-Gomez takes Amanda on a high-energy day in Albuquerque. From throwing punches inside the octagon to dancing up high on aerial silks, this dynamic duo never seems to break a sweat.

programme.title: Queens of Birmingham

programme.title: Mississippi Infant Mortality Emergency
programme.desc: Mississippi has declared a public health emergency over infant mortality. Scripps News reports from the Delta where miles, money, and missing services separate moms and babies from care.

programme.title: Roman In Red And Black
programme.desc: Filmed over three years, a Ukrainian sharpshooter's raw dispatches from the frontlines catch the world's attention. Scripps News traces Roman's journey from frontline legend to a soldier battling a new enemy that nearly finishes him: his own mind.

programme.title: Operation Royal Charm: Smuggler's Blues
programme.desc: FBI agent Lou Calverese goes undercover to infiltrate the lucrative world of international smuggling. What begins as a case of black market cigarettes soon involves military weapons, 100-dollar counterfeit bills and drugs, all entering US ports undetected. Calverese comes up with a brilliant take-down scheme to nab everyone involved in the smuggling - a personal invitation to his fabricated wedding. After receiving Rolex watches and other gifts, Calverese and the FBI do a takedown of the wedding guests.

programme.title: Operation Nautilus: Pakistani Hash On The High Seas
programme.desc: US Customs agent Paul DeCotiis is part of an international undercover plan to intercept 70 tons of Pakistani hashish in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. Customs uses a seized boat to meet the traffickers near Midway Island. High seas prevent most of the hash being transferred to the undercover boat, but Customs follows the drugs to the traffickers. DeCotiis is the point man throughout the operation between the Customs undercover team and a group of Canadian hippies hoping for a big payday. DeCotiis finally delivers the hash to the traffickers, resulting in several life sentences.

programme.title: Operation Shattered Shield: Nabbing Dirty Cops
programme.desc: FBI agent Juan Jackson goes undercover to build a case against corrupt New Orleans police officers, in the most corrupt city in America. Jackson learns that cops are ripping off street dealers, stealing their drugs and profiting from the sale of narcotics. They're using intimidation, violence, and ultimately, murder to silence witnesses who might consider testifying against them. Jackson befriends the corrupt cops to record their conversations and he becomes a target when they order a hit on him. In the end, 23 officers are indicted on various charges and the case forever changes the New Orleans police department.

programme.title: Operation Chokehold: Busting Boston's Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Vince delaMontaigne infiltrates the powerful La Cosa Nostra mob in an attempt to break their stranglehold on organized crime in Boston. To do this, delaMontaigne befriends Biagio DiGiacomo in the restaurant he owns and becomes one of the regulars who make deals and plot various ways to make a dishonest dollar. His efforts finally pay off but not before he's entangled in illegal betting, drug sales and extortion simply by playing his undercover role so well and being in the right place at the right time.

programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Host Dave Holmes meets celebrity guests at the airport bar to discuss must-do activities in cities across America. So when you’re ready to board your next flight, you’ll have an Esquire-approved itinerary.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.
